results.title: China: changes from within (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Focuses on the manifestations of social economic and political changes that are taking place in China. These changes will take place over a long time, however the atmosphere which has allowed them is evidence of a trend towards a more ‘democratic socialism’.
results.description: Focuses on the manifestations of social economic and political changes that are taking place in China. These changes will take place over a long time, however the atmosphere which has allowed them is evidence of a trend towards a more ‘democratic socialism’.

results.title: China. Part 3. Life in the city
results.brief_description: Shows daily life in Peking, including scenes of schooling, shopping, religious ceremonies, and construction of new blocks of flats and a causeway. Describes the emphasis placed on health and fitness. Edited version of “China!”.

results.title: China. Part 2. Life in the country
results.brief_description: Reveals China as a land of contrasts. Shows sheep herding in the Sunkiang province, terraced hillsides planted with rice in the more temperate areas, inland lakes and rivers which provide fish, life in country towns, and harvesting activities. Edited from “China!”.

results.title: China. Part 1. History and culture
results.brief_description: Descibes China’s early history, the war with Japan, the revolution and rise of communism. Shows modern industry and transport, the city of Shanghai, Chinese theatre, story telling and musical performances. Edited from the feature documentary ‘China!’

results.title: China!
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Dateline Film Productions
results.brief_description: Felix Greene spent several months and travelled over 15,000 miles throughout China to make this visual report on the day-to-day life of the Chinese people. Covers agriculture and industry in various parts of the country and discusses the political situation. Also features aspects of Chinese culture and social customs. Contains b&w archival footage. Music recorded in China by Felix Greene with the Peking Symphony Orchestra conducted by Li Teh-Lun.

results.title: China under communism
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, John T. Bobbitt and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: The changes in China today (1959); China’s most critical social and economic problems, and her position in world strategy. To obtain this material, author, editor and foreign correspondent, John Strohm, who first visited China in 1937, returned there in 1958 and travelled over 7,500 miles almost entirely without restriction, observing and photographing all phases of Chinese life.

results.title: China tour
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Si Tuan Lieng
results.brief_description: Si Tuan Lieng and his wife are retirees and have recently made an overseas trip to China. In this story he talks about his life and family, their integration into Australian society since they left Vietnam over 26 years ago and highlights of their holiday in China.

results.title: China today. No. 8206
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People's Republic of China
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Shows a glimpse of China’s many novel arts and crafts including the Cishou Kilns where much of China’s pottery is made; cork pictures; hair embroidery; root sculpture; stone pictures.

results.title: China today. No. 8205
results.creator_credit: Film Studio of the Peoples Republic of China
results.brief_description: Shows various aspects of China. An ancient city - Logang - showing its history and development. Adopting new techniques and building new high voltage power lines and towers. Working a new power shovel - sewage treatment. A family reunion - a man returning to the mainland of china. A new Archbishop is ordained in the Christian faith. The filming of “Midnight” a motion film.
